page.title: 12FARMING CHANGING LAND USE
page.content: Along most of the western part of the block there is farmland although this is under great pressure from the needs of the city as more housing is needed to cope with the ever-increasing population of the city and its suburbs.The population of the city is now estimated at around 92,000,making it the fourth largest city in Ireland. Most of the farming which is carried out is dairy farming or raising cattle and sheep for meat.Recently the abbatoir and livestock market moved from the city out to the eastern suburbs, where it is nearer to the large farms. Some cereal crops such as corn, barley,oats, potatoes,cabbage,turnips and some carrots are grown to supply local needs.All in all it seems as if farming in this block will soon be a piece of history.
